result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles W. Edge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Charles W. Edge is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Charles W. Edge was found guilty of Child Enticement-Expose Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(3).
  • Charles W. Edge was found guilty of Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • Charles W. Edge was found guilty of Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall pay the court cost in this matter.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall have no contact with victim and victim's family. 
Defendant shall complete all programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment. 
Defendant shall complete Sex Offender Treatment. 
Defendant shall submit DNA sample. 
Defendant shall payment of Supervision Fees and Court Obligations. 
Defendant shall register as a Sex Offender.

Case called at 2:07 PM.  Defendant Charles W. Edge in court with attorney Robert S. Duxstad.  Gary L. Luhman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court has received motion filed and reviewed briefs of parties.  Attorney Luhman informs court will need an addition 30 days to get complete discovery packet.  Court has found probable cause after hearing to authorize a view of premises, only viewing farm premises not living residence.  Court will allow, but limited to no longer than 1 hour and must must be prearranged.  Defendant and Attorney Duxstad can attend viewing along with Attorney Luhman and Detective Gately.  Part of pre-trial discovery not shared with witnesses until court has made determination of jury view.  Attorney Luhman will draft order from today's hearing for the court's signature.  Status conference scheduled for May 3, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
